KnowledgeBase.Title: stringCiGE
KnowledgeBase.HumanKeywords: compare string equal boolean case-insensitive greater

Function.Description: The stringCiGE function performs a case-insensitive comparison two Strings and determines whether the first String is greater than or equal to the second String. A Boolean value is returned.

Brief.Overview: The stringCiGE function performs a case-insensitive comparison between the two strings {string1} and {string2}. If {string1} is greater than or equal to {string2}, true is returned; otherwise, false is returned.
Brief.Usage: Use the stringCiGE function when you wish to have a case-insensitive comparison of two Strings and determine if the first String is greater than or equal to the second String. The result is expressed as a Boolean value (true or false).

Argument.Name: string1
Argument.Note: The first String or Text to be compared

Argument.Name: string2
Argument.Note: The second String or Text to be compared

Syntax.Return: Returns true if the first String is greater than or equal to the second String and false if the first String is lesser in value than the second String.
